channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US hospitals 'scrambling' after Trump admin's 'abrupt' change to Covid-19 data reporting requirements
Inside the multibillion dollar vaccine race
Vaccine trial investigator says results unlikely before end of 2020
Wellington mayor discusses New Zealand's new coronavirus cases
item.description: CNN's Richard Quest spoke with Andy Foster, the mayor of New Zealand's capital Wellington, about the country's response to the coronavirus as New Zealand reported 14 new coronavirus cases and imposed a lockdown in the city of Auckland.

item.title: Trump's birtherism attack on Harris is killing the Republican Party
Marge Simpson responds to Trump adviser's Kamala Harris comparison
item.description: Doh! Politics have really gotten serious when a beloved but fictional animated character feels compelled to defend herself against a real-world slight.

item.title: How Trump could lose the popular vote by millions and still win
item.description: CNN's Harry Enten breaks down the Electoral College math that could see President Trump lose the general election by more than 5 million votes and still win the general election.

item.title: Obama slams Trump's attacks on the postal service
Bernie Sanders on USPS: Trump is crazy, not stupid
item.description: In an interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper, Sen. Bernie Sanders (D-VT) said President Donald Trump is "crazy, not stupid" when it comes to the plan he told Fox Business about in an interview to withhold funds for USPS over mail-in ballots.

item.title: Justice Department disrupts millions of barrels of Iranian fuel shipment bound for Venezuela
item.description: A multimillion-dollar fuel shipment from a designated foreign terrorist organization in Iran to Venezuela was disrupted by the Justice Department, according to a Friday news release.

item.title: QAnon is conspiratorial, dangerous, and growing. And we're talking about it all wrong.
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: Former FBI lawyer set to plead guilty to altering email during Russia investigation
item.description: An FBI lawyer who worked on the surveillance warrant of former Trump foreign policy adviser Carter Page plans to plead guilty Friday to making a false statement in an email as part of an investigation into the Russia investigation.

item.title: Thousands ask for 'White Pride' billboard to come down near KKK headquarters
item.description: There's a renewed push for the removal of a controversial billboard in an Arkansas town near the headquarters of the Ku Klux Klan.

item.title: Belarus riot police drop shields and are embraced by anti-government protesters
item.description: At least 50 Belarus security personnel in riot gear dropped their shields and were embraced by anti-government protesters in Minsk, as demonstrators chanted "brothers" at the police.

item.title: Donald Trump's brother Robert hospitalized in New York, White House says
item.description: Robert Trump, the younger brother of President Donald Trump, is hospitalized in New York, the White House confirmed Friday.

item.title: We landed dream jobs as caretakers of an Irish island -- then Covid struck
item.description: It was Valentine's Day this year that Dublin couple Annie Birney and Eoin Boyle found out they'd landed what might just be the world's most romantic job.

item.title: Hong Kong media tycoon says 'the fight has to go on' after 'symbolic' arrest under new law
item.description: Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai has called his arrest a "symbolic exercise" by local authorities to demonstrate that the sweeping national security law imposed by Beijing last month has "teeth."

item.title: Trump's DHS leadership appointments are 'invalid,' report says
item.description: The appointments of Chad Wolf and Ken Cuccinelli to the top two leadership roles at the Department of Homeland Security are invalid, the Government Accountability Office found in a new report, delivering a major rebuke to the Trump administration, which has repeatedly tried to skirt the confirmation process.

item.title: Famed Indian film singer on life support in ICU
item.description: One of India's most renowned film singers, SP Balasubrahmanyam, is on life support following hospitalization for Covid-19, the hospital treating him said in a bulletin Friday.

item.title: Chelsea Clinton describes abuse she receives from anti-vaxxers
item.description: While some families in the US are concerned about the potential effects of taking a vaccine, others are exploiting fears by spreading misinformation online. CNN's Elizabeth Cohen speaks with vaccine advocate Chelsea Clinton about the battle for facts.

item.title: Prosecutors ask judge to deny Ghislaine Maxwell's request for accusers' identities
item.description: Federal prosecutors have asked a judge to deny Ghislaine Maxwell's request to be told the identities of the women who allege the former British socialite and girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein recruited, groomed and ultimately sexually abused them as young girls.

item.title: 'China's Netflix' is being investigated by the SEC for alleged fraud
item.description: Investors are getting nervous about iQiyi, the online streaming provider often referred to as the "Netflix of China," as regulators examine allegations of inflated earnings.

item.title: Don Lemon: Guess how many of Harris' Republican colleagues stood up for her?
item.description: After President Trump floated a baseless birther theory about Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA), CNN's Don Lemon said his producers reached out to all 53 of Harris' GOP colleagues in the Senate for comment.

item.title: Fishermen rescue paddleboarders missing at sea for 15 hours
item.description: A fisherman and his son have been praised for saving the lives of two young paddleboarders who were found clinging to a lobster pot after going missing off the west coast of Ireland for 15 hours.

item.title: Pentagon to start investigating UFO sightings
item.description: The Pentagon has formed a new task force to investigate UFO sightings observed by the US military, according to defense officials.

item.title: Dolly Parton makes her feelings known on Black Lives Matter
item.description: Country singer Dolly Parton is making it clear that she supports the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: Even TikTok has a white supremacy problem
item.description: Nazis and white supremacists have been using TikTok to spread hate speech and recruit followers, the Anti-Defamation League said in a report Thursday.

item.title: FC Dallas and MLS condemn 'appalling' and 'repulsive' racist comments
item.description: FC Dallas and Major League Soccer (MLS) have strongly condemned the racist comments and threats made against US soccer star Reggie Cannon after the Dallas player criticized some fans for booing players who took a knee.

item.title: See the moment officer saves man in wheelchair from train
item.description: A California police officer rescued a man in a wheelchair from the path of an oncoming train.

item.title: Tokyo has a drive-in haunted house. And it's terrifying
item.description: We can all agree that screaming is a pivotal part of a great haunted house experience.

item.title: Hailstorm of 'icy ping pong balls' pelts cyclists during race
item.description: The second stage of cycling's Critérium du Dauphiné ended in chaos as riders were pelted by large hailstones.

item.title: Every Sumatran rhino has died in Malaysia. Scientists want to bring them back with cloning technology
item.description: Iman, the last Sumatran rhino in Malaysia, died last November -- bringing the endangered species one step closer to extinction.

item.title: Hubble spies the culprit behind Betelgeuse star's dimming. And it may be happening again
item.description: The Hubble Space Telescope may have solved the mystery of the curiously dimming star Betelgeuse, according to new research.

item.title: Spanish official says outbreaks are the 'new normal' as cases rise in Europe
item.description: Spain, France and Greece are all seeing sharp rises in coronavirus cases as experts warn more deaths will come if measures to slow the spread aren't taken soon. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

item.title: The secret of Birkenstock's enduring success
item.description: Pandemic restrictions have meant one thing for most wardrobes: comfort. As many of us continue to work from home -- and staying safe with a trip to the park remains the height of summer's social calendar -- sensible flat sandals are now more pervasive than ever.

item.title: Why it's important to remember that Andy Warhol was working class
item.description: Beyond the downtown glamour associated with the artist and his famous friends, Warhol's working-class roots had a profound influence on his art. This rarely considered aspect of his life is explored in an exhibition at Tate Modern in London.

item.title: RZA came up with a new ice cream truck jingle because the old one was used in minstrel shows
item.description: The ice cream truck jingle of your childhood is about to get an upgrade -- and RZA is behind it.

item.title: Late-night host has parents review racy new Cardi B video
item.description: The parents of late-night host James Corden joined "The Late Late Show" to offer their review of Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion's new music video for their hit song "WAP."

item.title: Kelly Clarkson takes on Twitter troll
item.description: Kelly Clarkson took on a social media follower who trolled her about her divorce from ex-husband, Brandon Blackstock.

item.title: Dennis Quaid, the actor, adopts Dennis Quaid, the cat
item.description: Hollywood actor Dennis Quaid has a furry new friend -- a cute black rescue cat. Its name? Dennis Quaid.

item.title: The dam that Egypt has threatened to go to war over
item.description: The Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam on the Ethiopian border with Sudan is challenging a century-old rights question over access to the waters of the Nile.

item.title: Michael Jordan's game-worn sneakers set new record
item.description: A pair of Nikes worn by Michael Jordan has broken the record for the most expensive sneakers ever sold at auction, fetching $615,000.

item.title: Return to the wild: The chef bringing foraged food to the table
item.description: Roushanna Gray grew up on the wild side.

item.title: How 11-year-old Gui Khury made skateboarding history with first 1080 on a vertical ramp
item.description: Even before he was born, Gui Khury owned a skateboard, and even before he could walk, Khury was learning to skate.

item.title: The world bets on one thing to halt the pandemic: A vaccine. This is what it takes to bring one to the masses.
Politics and xenophobia cloud race for a vaccine in Brazil
item.description: For a country ravaged by the coronavirus, Brazil might welcome a race to create the first vaccine on its own soil -- with the potential for early dibs.

item.title: UK removes France from its list of 'safe' destinations
item.description: The UK has reimposed a 14-day quarantine on all arrivals from France after the country recorded a sharp rise in Covid-19 cases.

item.title: Trump administration's 'abrupt' change has hospitals 'scrambling'
item.description: In a letter, public health advisers to the US government said they are "extremely concerned" and "troubled" by the Trump administration's decision to change how hospitals report Covid-19 data.

item.title: 'No way in hell': US rejects Russia offers to help with vaccine
Thousands of new Covid-19 cases reported in Georgia
